courses.description: Building on numbers, operations, measurements, shapes, and basic problem solving.

lessons.description: Understanding the value of digits in numbers and writing them in words.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn to read, write, and interpret numbers up to 10,000. Teachers explain units, tens, hundreds, and thousands, and demonstrate writing numbers in words. Pupils practice with exercises, focusing on addition and subtraction involving multi-digit numbers.

lessons.lessonTitle: Addition and Subtraction of Large Numbers
lessons.description: Adding and subtracting numbers beyond 1,000.
lessons.textContent: Pupils solve problems involving large numbers using column methods. Teachers demonstrate step-by-step addition and subtraction with real-life examples such as money, population, and distances. Exercises enhance accuracy, concentration, and practical application in everyday situations.

lessons.description: Learning multiplication tables and basic division techniques.
lessons.textContent: Pupils revise multiplication tables up to 12 and learn long multiplication. Division is introduced through sharing equally and repeated subtraction. Teachers give practical problems involving everyday scenarios like distributing books, fruits, or coins, fostering comprehension and numerical reasoning.

lessons.description: Introduction to parts of a whole and decimal numbers.
lessons.textContent: Pupils explore fractions (½, ¼, ⅓) using visual aids such as slices of fruit and sections of paper. Teachers explain how to write decimals and relate them to fractions. Exercises include comparing, adding, and subtracting simple fractions and decimals, encouraging logical thinking.

lessons.description: Learning about 2D and 3D shapes and measuring objects.
lessons.textContent: Pupils identify circles, triangles, squares, rectangles, cubes, and spheres. Teachers demonstrate measuring length, weight, and capacity using rulers, scales, and measuring jugs. Pupils solve practical problems involving perimeter, area, and volume. Visual and video examples strengthen understanding.

courses.description: Developing reading, writing, speaking, listening, and comprehension skills.

lessons.description: Understanding and interpreting short stories and passages.
lessons.textContent: Pupils read age-appropriate stories and answer questions on main ideas, characters, and events. Teachers model comprehension strategies such as predicting, summarizing, and asking questions. Pupils practice discussing stories orally and in writing, enhancing vocabulary and understanding.

lessons.description: Learning new words and their correct usage.
lessons.textContent: Pupils explore new words from texts and daily experiences. Teachers explain meanings, use in sentences, synonyms, and antonyms. Pupils practice using words in writing and speaking activities, building a richer vocabulary for communication.

lessons.description: Introduction to nouns, verbs, adjectives, and sentence formation.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about subject, predicate, tense, and correct punctuation. Teachers provide examples and model sentence formation. Exercises involve correcting mistakes, completing sentences, and writing short paragraphs, reinforcing clarity and grammar usage.

lessons.description: Developing descriptive and narrative writing.
lessons.textContent: Pupils write short stories, letters, and descriptions of people, places, and events. Teachers demonstrate planning, drafting, and revising work. Pupils practice writing coherently, using correct grammar and punctuation, and sharing work with classmates for feedback.

lessons.description: Practicing clear speech, listening, and oral presentations.
lessons.textContent: Pupils engage in storytelling, role-play, and discussions. Teachers guide pronunciation, tone, and active listening. Pupils listen to audio recordings and respond appropriately. Activities enhance confidence, comprehension, and communication skills.

courses.description: Exploring the natural world, living things, materials, and basic scientific concepts.

lessons.description: Understanding the characteristics of living and non-living things.
lessons.textContent: Pupils identify living things such as plants, animals, and humans, and non-living things like rocks, water, and chairs. Teachers explain characteristics like growth, movement, and reproduction. Pupils classify objects in the classroom and at home, fostering observation and analytical skills.

lessons.description: Learning about roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits.
lessons.textContent: Pupils study plant parts and their functions. Teachers demonstrate using real plants and visual aids. Pupils identify parts in school garden and in pictures. Understanding plants promotes knowledge of food sources, environment, and scientific observation.

lessons.description: Introduction to body parts and their functions.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about head, hands, legs, heart, lungs, and other organs. Teachers explain functions in simple terms. Pupils discuss how the body works together, importance of exercise, and ways to stay healthy.

lessons.description: Learning about essential elements in the environment.
lessons.textContent: Pupils explore the importance of water, air, and soil for living things. Teachers demonstrate simple experiments like soil filtration and air observation. Pupils discuss conservation, cleanliness, and uses in daily life.

lessons.description: Understanding the different weather types and seasonal changes in Nigeria.
lessons.textContent: Pupils identify sunny, rainy, cloudy, and windy weather. Teachers explain rainy, dry, and harmattan seasons. Pupils record weather changes, relate to clothing, activities, and crops, enhancing environmental awareness.

courses.description: Understanding society, culture, geography, and civic responsibilities.

lessons.description: Learning about the local community and its members.
lessons.textContent: Pupils explore different types of communities: urban, rural, and semi-urban. Teachers explain roles of people like teachers, traders, and farmers. Pupils discuss community helpers, observe surroundings, and understand cooperation and interdependence.

lessons.description: Understanding how people move and communicate.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about various modes of transport: cars, bicycles, boats, and planes. Teachers explain telephones, radio, internet, and letters for communication. Pupils discuss advantages, safety, and cultural impact of transport and communication.

lessons.description: Introduction to buying, selling, and trading in society.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about local markets, goods sold, and barter vs money trade. Teachers demonstrate with examples like buying fruits or clothes. Pupils role-play buying and selling, developing understanding of commerce, responsibility, and basic economics.

lessons.description: Learning about the Nigerian flag, anthem, and coat of arms.
lessons.textContent: Pupils identify national symbols and their meanings. Teachers explain the importance of patriotism and respect. Pupils sing the national anthem, describe the flag, and understand civic pride.

lessons.description: Exploring Nigerian festivals and cultural practices.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about traditional dances, music, and cultural celebrations. Teachers show videos of Eyo, Osun-Osogbo, and Durbar festivals. Pupils discuss cultural diversity, traditions, and community values.

courses.description: Introduction to simple machines, tools, and technological processes.

lessons.description: Learning about basic tools used at home and school.
lessons.textContent: Pupils identify tools like hammers, scissors, knives, and rulers. Teachers explain safe usage and purposes. Pupils practice proper handling, reinforcing safety and practical skills.

lessons.description: Understanding levers, pulleys, and inclined planes.
lessons.textContent: Pupils explore how simple machines make work easier. Teachers demonstrate with classroom examples such as see-saws, water pumps, and inclined ramps. Pupils engage in hands-on activities, improving observation and problem-solving.

lessons.description: Introduction to basic construction principles.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about materials like wood, bricks, and metals. Teachers demonstrate simple building activities using blocks or sticks. Pupils understand stability, measurement, and teamwork during construction projects.

lessons.description: Basic understanding of energy sources and their uses.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about human, solar, wind, and water energy. Teachers explain how machines use energy for movement and work. Pupils discuss examples like fans, water pumps, and simple motors, developing scientific awareness.

lessons.description: Learning safe practices when using machines and tools.
lessons.textContent: Pupils understand the importance of caution when handling tools. Teachers show videos of proper tool use, wearing protective gear, and avoiding hazards. Pupils practice safety in classroom activities.

courses.description: Exploring visual arts, music, dance, drama, and cultural expressions.

lessons.description: Learning drawing techniques and color application.
lessons.textContent: Pupils practice sketching objects from home and school. Teachers explain shading, proportions, and color combinations. Pupils work on creative projects to enhance imagination and observation skills.

lessons.description: Exploring songs, rhythm, and melody.
lessons.textContent: Pupils sing Nigerian folk songs and learn to follow simple rhythms. Teachers demonstrate using percussion instruments. Pupils improve listening skills, memory, and musical expression.

lessons.description: Learning traditional dances and simple choreography.
lessons.textContent: Pupils practice cultural dances and basic modern steps. Teachers demonstrate moves and encourage creativity. Dancing enhances coordination, physical fitness, and cultural appreciation.

lessons.description: Acting out stories and social situations.
lessons.textContent: Pupils perform skits and role-plays. Teachers guide expression, gestures, and dialogue. Pupils develop creativity, confidence, and communication skills.

lessons.description: Making creative craft items.
lessons.textContent: Pupils create greeting cards, models, and decorations using paper, clay, and other materials. Teachers demonstrate techniques. Pupils develop fine motor skills, patience, and artistic creativity.

courses.description: Promoting fitness, healthy habits, and safety.

lessons.description: Learning exercises to stay fit.
lessons.textContent: Pupils practise stretching, jogging, and games. Teachers demonstrate routines. Exercises improve strength, stamina, and coordination.

lessons.description: Understanding balanced diet and nutrition.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about food groups, benefits, and portion control. Teachers explain practical tips. Pupils reflect on meals at home and school.

lessons.description: Maintaining cleanliness.
lessons.textContent: Pupils practise hand washing, brushing teeth, and bathing. Teachers explain germs and illness prevention.

lessons.description: Avoiding accidents and following rules.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn safe practices around hazards. Teachers demonstrate precautions. Pupils role-play safety scenarios.

lessons.description: Simple first aid for minor injuries.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn to clean cuts, apply bandages, and seek help. Teachers demonstrate proper techniques.

courses.description: Understanding rights, responsibilities, and good citizenship.

lessons.description: Understanding what it means to be responsible in society.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about respect, honesty, and helping others. Teachers discuss roles of citizens at home and school. Pupils practise kindness and responsibility.

lessons.description: Importance of following rules.
lessons.textContent: Pupils understand classroom, school, and community rules. Teachers explain why rules prevent chaos. Pupils discuss consequences of breaking rules.

lessons.description: Knowing what they are entitled to and what they owe society.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn basic rights like education and play, and responsibilities like helping at home. Teachers guide discussions and examples.

lessons.description: Contributing to the wellbeing of the community.
lessons.textContent: Pupils explore helping in cleanup, planting trees, and assisting neighbours. Teachers explain benefits of participation.

lessons.description: Learning about Nigeria, unity, and patriotism.
lessons.textContent: Pupils learn about the Nigerian flag, anthem, and national symbols. Teachers show videos of unity celebrations. Pupils discuss national pride and respect for diversity.
